trips.title: A day like an outlaw in the Glacierfjords
trips.description:
We offer you a unique one day’s hike in the Hornstrandir area with a local guide.

We will take you by boat to the abandoned area of the Glacierfjords were the hike will start. We will take land where there are no roads nor villages as the last farmers moved away in the beginning of the 1950´s. During the day we will get a view over Westfjords only Glacier, Drangajökull, enjoy the stroll by the seafront and cross an unbridged glacier river. We will hike through the lowlands where Iceland´s most famous outlaw, Fjalla-Eyvindur (Mountain-Eyvindur), lived and died. An experienced guide will entertain you with the remarkable story of Fjalla-Eyvindur, the history of the area and stories of people that lived there. The hike is about 12 km.
trips.excerpt: A moderate hike for people in good shape. Hiking distance is about 12 km on rough ground and very little elevation
trips.requirements:
Warm and wind/waterproof clothes

Solid hiking boots

Gloves and cap, 

Lunch pack and something to drink!

Wading shoes are optional, but it would be a good idea to bring a small towel to dry your feet after being in the water.

trips.title: FJORD WANDERING - biking
trips.description:
From Tálknafjörður we will cycle to Sveinseyri, with its own world of magnificent birdlife and white sandy beaches.

We will visit Sellátrar, old abandoned and very remote farm, now used as a summer cabin. Though it has always been the opinion of experts that trees are not able to grow in this area, you actually find the western-most grove in Europe at Arnarstapi, settled in a stunning landscape. On the shore below are some remains of fishtermens' huts, since until 1930 this was a popular place for fishermen to row out. It is said that Arnarstapi is an energy centre where you can recharge all your energy levels.

The hot spring pool Pollurinn is located in the hillside just outside the village of Tálknafjörður. It is a great way to relax after the bicycle tour, like local fishermen have done for centuries after a long hardworking day, and admire the extraordinary view accross the fjord. On this tour you get intimate encounter with incredible nature and great birdlife. The tour is especially recommended for nature lovers and photographers. 

Transportation between Patreksfjörður and Tálknafjörður included in time schedule and prices. The sheer biking is approx. 4-5 hours.
trips.included: Local guidance in English, bike, helmet and transportation.
trips.requirements: Advisable to wear comfortable warm clothing. We recommend that you bring a backpack, water bottle and light shoes. Don't forget your swimsuits.

agendaItems.title: Fjord Wandering
agendaItems.body:
From Tálknafjörður we will cycle to Sveinseyri, with its own world of magnificent bird life and white sandy beaches.

We will visit Sellátrar, old abandoned and remote farm, now used as a summer cabin. though it has always been the option of experts that trees are unable to grow in this area you find the western-most grove in Europe at Arnarstapi. In the shore below are some remains of fisherman´s huts, since until 1930 this was a popular place for fishermen to tow out. It is said that Arnarstapi is an energy center where you can recharge all your energy levels.

The hot spring pool Pollurinn is located in the hillside just outside the village of Tálknafjörður. It is a great way ti relax after the bicycle tour and admire the extraordinary view over the fjord. On this tour you will get intimate encounter with incredible nature and great bird life. The tour is especially recommended for nature lovers and photographers.

trips.title: CROWN JEWEL; KJARAN'S AVENUE & DYNJANDI - jeep tour
trips.description:
Enjoy the exceptional Kjaran's avenue, which is anything but an avenue! This unique road constructions, claimed to be mission impossible, named after its builder, who made the road in his own spare time by a small bulldozer. Near Svalvogar, the one-way jeep track is carved into the mountain, which looms above you and the steep cliffs are almost vertical under your feet down to the ocean. On the stony beach of Skútabjörg, one better be aware of the sea tide. This is one of the most incredible road constructions in Iceland and the scenery en-route is incomparable. This magnificent tour leaves no one untouched for its unique landscape and sheer thrilling drive experience.

We get close to Kaldbakur, the highest mountain in Westfjords and might hike the top to enjoy incomparable scenery, weather and road conditions permitting. Alternatively we take the old winding main road through Hrafnseyrarheiði, which is closed for 6-8 months every year due to snow. 

We stop at the unique Dynjandi waterfall, one of Iceland's most beautiful waterfalls and the largest in the Westfjords, ca. 100 meters high and up to 60 meters wide. A hiking path leads up to the central gorge of the waterfall, allowing visitors to come close enough to touch the water as it tumbles down into the depths.

Various stops and refreshments on our way.
trips.included: Local guidance in English, jeep transportation and entrance to Hrafnseyri museum.
trips.requirements: Warm outdoor clothing and good shoes recommended

trips.title: HIKE BETWEEN TWO FJORDS - hiking
trips.description:
The tour starts by walking from the Westfjords Adventures office in Patreksfjörður to Tálknafjörður by an old route between the two fjords, Patreksfjörður and Tálknafjörður. While walking through Litlidalur and passing Lambeyrarháls, the local guide will tell you about the history of Patreksfjörður and Tálknafjörður, which are both rich of history as bases of English, French, German and Dutch sailors, merchants and navy mariners in the early days. 

From Lambeyrarháls we will walk to Suðureyri, where Norwegians established and ran a whaling station around 1900. In Suðureyri is a famous ground depression, which is believed to be a fairy settlement. If travellers lie down to rest in the depression they are destined to dream about their future. Around Tálknafjörður is a great birdlife and the scenery is amazing.

The tour starts at 09:00 in the morning. We will be picked up by a minivan at the end of the hike in Tálknafjörður and brought back to Patreksfjörður. The tour takes approximately 6 hours, including transportation. Walking distance 7 km, 5 hours, elevation 330 meter. Difficulty: Easy.
trips.included: Local guidance in English and transportation.
trips.requirements: Advisable to wear comfortable warm clothing. We recommend that you bring a backpack and a water bottle. Please wear hiking boots.

agendaItems.title: Hike Between tow Fjords
agendaItems.body:
We walk from Patreksfjörður to Tálknafjörður by an old tout between the two fjords. While walking through Litlidalur and passing Lambeyrarháls, the local guide will tell you about the history of Patreksfjörður and Tálknafjörður, which are rich of history as basees if English, French, German and Duch sailors, merchants and navy mariners.

From Lambeyrarháls we will walk to Suðureyri, where Norwegians established and ran a whaling station around 1900. In Suðureyri is a famous ground depression which is believed to be a fairy settlement. If travellers lie down to rest in the depression they are destined to drea ablout their future. Around Tálknafjörður is a great bird life and the scenery is amazing.

trips.title: Vigur - Paradise Island
trips.description:
There is always something charming about small islands, and the harmony of thousands of birds in Vigur completes the beautiful landscape. Over the years, the island Vigur has earned itself a great reputation and is therefore a must on any itinerary. Its five friendly inhabitants welcome you with their relaxed easy manner and somehow, one feels that time stands still in Vigur.

After a half an hour boat ride from Ísafjörður, you take a leisurely walk around the island. It´s a perfect opportunity to see the abundance of birds in their natural environment. The island is a home for thousands of birds e.g. eider ducks, arctic terns, puffins, black guillemot and more. The only windmill in Iceland is located in Vigur. Refreshments are served by the farmer’s family.

Prior to heading back, you can visit the smallest post office in Europe and send home a card or two. The tour takes approximately 3 hours.
trips.included: boat tour, guidance, light refreshments at the island.
trips.requirements: Waterproofed jacket, sturdy walking shoes, hat and gloves
trips.attention: Not suitable for physically disabled nor for wheelchairs as it includes a walk on uneven paths.

trips.title: Whale Watching in Ísafjarðardjúp
trips.description: We offer 3 hours whale watching tour from Ísafjörður harbor in a comfortable passengers boat with 48 indoor seats. After an easy boarding it’s time to sail into Ísafjarðardjúp, the stunning fjord region just off Ísafjörður. The landscape we will enjoy from the boat is one of a kind and sure to give you a lot of photo moments, so do not forget the camera. The chances of whale spotting are high and until mid august you might also see puffins and other sea birds having a swim. Our captains have lived in the area for a long time and know where the whales like to hang out.
trips.excerpt: Whale watching in the largest fjord in Iceland, Ísafjarðardjúp. Boat with indoor seating area for 48 guests.
trips.attention: It is important to wear warm clothes, caps and mittens, it gets cold once out on the sea.
